job description:
Senior Scientist BioPharmaceutical Analytical Development

Zoetis is a global animal health company dedicated to supporting customers and their businesses. Building on 60 years of experience, we deliver quality medicines, biopharmaceuticals and vaccines, complemented by diagnostic products and genetic tests and supported by a range of services. We are working every day to better understand and address the real-world challenges faced by those who raise and care for animals in ways they find truly relevant.

Zoetis discovers, develops and manufactures a diverse portfolio of animal health medicines, biopharmaceuticals and vaccines designed to meet the real-world needs of veterinarians and the livestock farmers and companion animal owners they support. Zoetis has the first monoclonal antibody therapy for treating atopic dermatitis in dogs. We are currently seeking to fill new positions to support our growing biopharmaceutical portfolio.

Zoetis Veterinary Medicine Research and Development, Analytical Sciences in Kalamazoo, MI is seeking an analytical scientist at the Senior Scientist/Principal Scientist level.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
  • Develop test methods to evaluate the potency and binding of biopharmaceuticals, including cell-based bioassays and ligand binding assays.
  • Lead cell-based bioassay and ligand binding assay method development, optimization, qualification/validation and method transfer studies.
  • Manage outsourced assay development projects at contract research organizations involving cell line development, cell-based bioassay and ligand binding feasibility, optimization and validation studies.
  • Represent Analytical Sciences on project teams, collaborating closely with scientists from Process Development, Therapeutic Research, Clinical, Regulatory, Project Management, and Quality Control to deliver robust methods and products. Provide input into project plans, keep relevant sections of project plans current, and execute plans according to agreed timelines and budgets.
  • Develop and/or adopt new analytical technology, as appropriate, to advance programs with significant analytical technical and timeline challenges.
  • Support Analytical Sciences assay-specific Critical Reagents and Reference Standards programs. Optimize, qualify, monitor performance and maintain inventory of assay specific Reference Standard and Critical Reagents used in cell-based bioassays and ligand binding assays. Create technical protocols and reports for Critical Reagents and Reference Standards.
  • Trend and report method and Critical Reagents performance data.
  • Document and communicate results in laboratory notebooks, technical reports, and oral presentations. Assist in the preparation and writing of regulatory filings.
  • Collaborate with other scientists in a variety of technical disciplines including Process Development, Biological Research, Clinical, Regulatory, Project Management, Quality Control and Manufacturing.
Minimum Qualifications:
  • PhD in Biology, Biochemistry, Immunology or a related discipline
  • BS/MS with at least 5 years' hands-on industry experience in cell-based bioassay and ligand binding methods development.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PhD in Biology, Biochemistry, Immunology or a related discipline with a minimum of 5 years of post-graduate experience in cell-based bioassay and ligand binding methods development in an industrial laboratory setting.
  • BS/MS with 10+ years hands-on industry experience in cell-based bioassay and ligand binding methods development in an industrial laboratory setting.
  • Individual with experience leading teams and/or managing scientists in the development of cell-based bioassays and ligand binding assays used to assess quality attributes of biopharmaceutical products in development.
  • An understanding of protein engineering and post translational modifications as they relate to receptor binding and biological activity.
  • Skills and past experience in design of experiments (DOE), technical problem solving and continuous improvement
  • Experience with G-protein coupled receptor (GPCR) pharmacology, biochemistry or cell biology.
  • Experience with biopharmaceutical development and product licensure.
  • Knowledge of the regulatory requirements (FDA, EMA, USDA) that apply to the development of tests to assess the biological activity of biopharmaceuticals tested under GMP release of biopharmaceuticals.
Full time

Regular
